result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
11:26 AM 
Defendant Lew A Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan T Oswald in court for Lew A Brown. Atty Yonke appears in person on behalf of the public defender.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Dodge calls the case and states appearances.
Court makes statements regarding a request for withdrawal of attorney.
Atty Oswald makes statements regarding the request and notes that the defendant is uncomfortable with his current counsel.
Court addresses Atty Yonke.
Atty Yonke states that the public defender's office does not object to the request, but asks that this be the last new attorney appointed.
Court questions the defendant regarding his appearances by video.
Defendant understands he could appear in person for this hearing.
Court notes that, if Atty Oswald is allowed to withdraw, this will be the last request the defendant can make for a new attorney.

BY THE COURT:
Motion to withdraw is granted.
Court directs the public defender to appoint a new attorney.
The next attorney appointed will not be allowed to withdraw by request of the defendant.

Defendant requests to continue appearing remotely.
Court makes statements in response.
Order to Produce filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 10/12/22 sp)
Letter from Atty Kate Frigo Drury to Judge Zell dated 10/10/22 in re:  request to make a special appearance at the Motion Hearing set for 10/24/22 (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 10/11/22 sp)
Motion hearing on October 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Letter from the Defendant dated 10/03/22 in re:  conflict with Atty Oswald representing him/request to have him withdraw and new counsel appointed
Proposed Order on Motion to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Nathan T Oswald (sent to Br 1 Judge on 09/27/22 sp)
Motion to Withdraw as Counsel for the Defendant filed by Atty Nathan T Oswald (sent to Br 1 Judge on 09/27/22 sp)
Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence, with attachment. Filed by Prosecutor.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
matter set for ptc 10/10/22 at 10:00
Defendant's Request for Discovery filed by Atty Nathan T Oswald
Atty Nathan Oswald appointed
Order Granting Motion to Withdraw /s/ MDZ 09/01/22

ADDRESS INFO for Lew A Brown
Current: 1 W Lincoln St, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2022)
Prior: 3450 Evergreen Dr #1, Plover, WI 54467
/s/ MDZ 08/31/22 - DECLINED:  Please file an Order Granting Motion to Withdraw. This document is captioned Motion and Order, but does not contain language for an Order.

8:35 AM Defendant Lew A Brown appeared by video, in custody at Dodge Correctional Institution.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Lew A Brown.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Dodge calls the case and states the appearances.
This is set for a motion to withdraw as counsel hearing.

Court makes statements to the defendant with regards to him appearing via ZOOM.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear telephonically and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily consenting to use of telephonic conferencing. 

Court informs the defendant with regards to what the hearing has been set for today.
A speedy trial demand had been filed in this case.
Jury Trial is set for next week.
Court questions Atty Jakobson.
Atty Jakobson indicates that is is by the request of his client that he wishes for him to withdraw.
Court questions the defendant if he was able to hear what his attorney had to say.
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant still wishes to have counsel represent him; defendant makes additional statements.
Defendant is asking the court to dismiss the case.   Court stops him from making further statements.
Defendant is informed that he has the right to counsel but does not have a choice as to who will represent him as this is public defender appointment.
Court states the issues on the record that need to be discussed today.
Attorney withdrawal:  Defendant still wishes for him to withdraw.
Speedy Trial Demand will be waived.
Public Defender will now need additional time to appoint new counsel.
Defendant makes statements with regards to his attorney withdrawing and had left several voice messages.
Defendant is informed that if he allows Atty Jakobson to withdraw that his trial will not go ahead as planned next week.
Defendant is informed that he is allowed to have attorney's withdraw but he is not allowed to choose who represents him.
Defendant is informed that multiple attorney's will not be appointed.
Defendant questions the court with regards to the public defender's office and attorney appointment and makes further statements.
Court makes statements to the defendant.
ADA Dodge puts on the record that the State has complied with the scheduling order.
Court makes further statements.
Neither party has anything else to put on the record.
8:50 a.m.  Defendant states that there is an issue with the speedy trial demand and states his issue on the record.
ADA Dodge makes statements with regards to the speedy trial demand.
Court will reconsider the motion to dismiss if there is a motion to dismiss filed.

BY THE COURT: 
Motion to Withdraw is GRANTED.
Atty Jakobson to contact the public defender's office to have new counsel represent the defendant.
Jury Trial to be removed from the court calendar.
Speedy Trial Request is withdrawn.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Lew A Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Lew A Brown.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Dodge calls the case and states the appearances.

Defendant received copy of the amended information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.
State has relayed an offer to the defendant.
ADA Dodge states that the defendant had requested a speedy trial.
Atty Jakobson makes statements.
Atty Jakobson would request a Pre-Trial Conference.
Speedy Trial time starts as of today's date and needs to be heard within next 90 days.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

records.addlTxt: Atty Oren Jakobson appointed
Letter From Defendant dated May 9, 2022 (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 05/10/22 sp)
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:16 PM Defendant Lew A Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Dodge is not certain if the defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.
Court is handed a piece of paper and she reviews.
Court makes statements to the defendant with regards to the letter received.
Defendant can ask for an adjournment.
Public Defender's Office continues to search for an attorney for the defendant.
FCC Dalkert is not allowed to appoint an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant states he wants a speedy trial.
Defendant does not want to represent himself be states he has no choice.
Court goes over the waiver of right to an attorney with the defendant on the record.
ADA Dodge would ask that the case be suspended and be put in front of a Judge.
FCC Dalkert states that she had spoken with Judge Eagon and puts on the record what Judge Eagon informed her of.
Defendant wishes to move forward.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is competent to waive his right to an attorney for today's hearing.
Defendant will represent himself at today's hearing.

Parties are ready to proceed with the preliminary hearing.
3:22 p.m.  A Gischia is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Dodge.
Witness identifies the defendant.
3:28 p.m.  Defendant does not wish to question the witness.
ADA Dodge does not have any additional witnesses.
Defendant does not have any witnesses.
3:29 p.m.  Defendant makes a brief statement.
ADA Dodge has a very brief statement.
Court informs ADA Dodge that an amended complaint will need to be done as there is missing information.
ADA Dodge states that an Amended Information had been filed correcting the issues as stated on the record.
Defendant has requested a speedy trial.
Defendant would ask for all discovery be provided to him.
ADA Dodge states that discovery is normally provided after the preliminary hearing and if he had not received they will provided to him.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment and Pre-Trial to be set at a later date.
Counting date for the speedy trial shall start as of today's date and not the June 13, 2022 date.
Defendant made an oral request for a speedy trial.
Discovery to be provided to the defendant.
Bond is continued
Arraignment scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on June 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report filed by Atty Kate Frigo Drury
Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

1:43 PM Defendant Lew A Brown appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant wants to proceed with an initial hearing today and understands he is waiving his right to counsel.
Defendant states he has not received his copy of his complaint.
Court will recall this case after the defendant has read his complaint.

2:15 PM Case is recalled.
Defendant still wishes to proceed today.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Defendant doesn't waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Defendant is on a PO hold.
Court sets the Preliminary Hearing and the Defendant understands that he may not have an attorney at that time.
State recommends a $10,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
BY THE COURT:  Bond is set
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
